summary: The bill, titled the PROTECT Firefighters Act, directs the United States Fire Administration to develop a comprehensive strategy to improve equipment, training, and staffing standards for firefighter Rapid Intervention Teams (RITs). This includes assessing current standards, identifying improvements needed for modern equipment and training, and ensuring interoperability. The strategy must also address RITs at maritime and port facilities, examining training, equipment, staffing, and potential barriers to improvement. The bill calls for a review of firefighter fatality reports and recommendations for congressional action to improve firefighter safety and preparedness.
